Cultural differences: Participants may come from different cultural backgrounds, leading to misunderstandings and conflicts.
Political tensions: The summit may involve representatives from countries with political tensions or conflicts, leading to heated discussions and disagreements.
Security concerns: The summit may attract unwanted attention from extremist groups or individuals, requiring increased security measures.
Funding and logistics: Organizing an international event can be expensive and logistically challenging, requiring careful planning and coordination.
Time zone differences: Participants from different countries may be in different time zones, making it difficult to schedule meetings and coordinate activities.
